title: Awesome Hotel LES
text: Love staying at the Moxy LES. The staff was super helpful and accommodating, especially Bernie, Jess, and Vincent. This will for sure be my go to hotel every time I come into town. It’s central to arguably the best part of NYC. I truly could not have had a better experience staying here.

title: Moxy at it's best
text:
We had an amazing experience at the Moxy, as always. Bernie at the checkin was amazingly helpful.

We like to stay at the Moxy, for the simplicity and straightforward service. Everything is clear and elegant!

The artistic elements that underline the concept differ from one Moxy to another, but the always just make the stay pleasant.

title: Great customer service and amenities!
text: Great new hotel. Fun bar and restaurant ambience is amazing. Shout out to Josh & Victor at the front desk, they helped make my stay 1000x easier and much more enjoyable, great staff here overall. Ask for them next time you need any assistance at the Lobby.

title: Bernie brought his A game!
text: From the moment I arrived, the valet swiftly took care of my vehicle. I was pleasantly surprised by a room upgrade, which added an extra touch of comfort to my stay. The check-in process was notably efficient, the quickest I’ve experienced at any Marriott property. It’s refreshing to see that they genuinely appreciate repeat business. Highly recommend for a seamless and rewarding experience.

title: Highly recommend
text: Location is convenient, coffee shop in Lobby is delish, gym and restaurant is great. Customer service is excellent ! Bernie and Kimberly are both so accommodating and amazing! Thank you for making my stay great! Highly recommend for your next stay in NY!

title: Super Hip Hotel!
text: First experience at a moxy & I had a blast! Thanks to the lovely staff and location. Thanks to victor & steph for a great check in and being very knowledgeable about the area. The lobby bar is great as well and you receive a credit towards it just make sure to use it daily. I was not able to try the restaurant but I did get to go up to the highlight room and enjoy a great drink with an amazing view. My friends enjoyed the hotel as well I would definitely recommend.

title: 10/10 Would Recommend
text: On my trip for the first time to NYC with my friend we had the pleasure of staying at the Moxy LES and it was hands down one of the best hotel experiences I have had in a long time.The rooftop bar was our main hangout spot. The views of the NYC skyline were unbelievable. I would especially like to highlight the front desk staff specifically Bernie who helped me and my friend Check in swiftly and because we told him it was our first time in New York he even went as far as to help us with any upgrade! He was very accessible and accommodating to any of our needs. I would definitely recommend anyone traveling to NYC stay at the Moxy LES.

title: Great first time at the hotel
text: I was at the Moxy late, last Saturday night, and had the best experience with Alex and the rest of the staff. Alex was so friendly and helpful, made my entire stay that much better. Because of how great my experience was, I’ll definitely be coming back to the Moxy very soon!

title: Fun Birthday Vibes Stay
text: From check in to check out it was a superb experience. Victor, Kimberly and Stephanie at the desk made me feel special. My room was decorated for my birthday and they were so nice to also give me access to the Silver Lining. Definitely a must come back!

title: Great hotel! Fun atmosphere. Friendly staff.
text: From check in to check out we had an amazing experience. Victor at the front desk was super welcoming and made us feel right at home. He made a great food recommendation since when we arrived it was between meals at the restaurants at the hotel. Our room had everything we needed and the bed was super comfortable. The doorman always greeted us with a friendly hello! We would come back for sure!

title: Will stay here again!
text: Had a great stay. The room was clean and attended to daily. The hotel has wonderful amenities included a showroom and rooftop bar so if you’re not trying to wander around NYC at night. Bernie and Sydney at the front desk are phenomenal and made accommodations for me when asked.

title: Brevity is the soul of wit
text:
Staid a night. Made a reservation last minute in the middle of the night (maybe 3 or 4 am). Staff was very helpful. Special thanks to Alex and Curtis, who made my stay possible and improved my experience. 

Room was clean and the hotel has a nice vibe.

title: Third Time’s a Charm
text:
This is our 3rd time staying at the Moxy LES and this stay was made more exceptional because of Jess. From the time we checked in, she stood out because of her bright and welcoming personality along with her willingness to accommodate our requests to ensure our comfort.

Now, for the hotel, we love the location: it’s a short 3 minute walk to the subway station and 10 minute walk from major stores and labels. The atmosphere is lively in the lobby and adjoining areas but you will sleep soundly in the comfortable rooms. We also enjoyed the amenities, like the gym and access to the “Stash Closet” for those last-minute needs. Overall, we enjoy our stay and look forward to many more.

title: Great stay..
text: Had a great experience at the lower east side Moxy Hotel. shout out to JADE for making my last day fantastic. My flight was massively delayed and she helped me prolong my stay. Over all the staff was helpful around all facets of the Hotel. Not crazy about the buttonless elevators though myself… Japanese restaurant in the basement was great, as was the rooftop lounge. Beds were firm and comfortable a plus!

title: The staff!
text: Great stay and incredibly accommodating and lovely staff (especially Josh and the front desk crew!!). Welcoming and convenient. Everyone was friendly and supportive. The room has an immaculate view and it’s all located in my favorite neighborhood in Manhattan.

title: Awesome stay
text: My stay was awesome! Rooms are small, but comfortable and clean. They have stash closets on some floors that have everything you need in case you forget something, which I loved. Jess and Syd at the front desk were amazing on my last day as well. Great trip from start to finish, I’ll definitely stay here again on my next trip back to NYC

title: Great Service
text: Alex and Curtis were a great help. Very accommodating and informative. They provided great food recommendations and made sure that we were aware of all policies and accommodations that were included in our booking. Definitely made the birthday smooth.

title: Great spot for work trip
text: Had an awesome stay for three nights for a work trip. The staff were outstanding. Victor and Kim helped all of our team get checked-in in no time. The rooms clean and modern. The coffee and food down in the lobby was great for when I was on my way out in the morning for meetings. The bar staff at night was also friendly, professional and provided great service.  Will stay here again!

title: Family Trip
text: Room was very comfortable, clean, and modern. Location of the hotel was very convenient. Staff were very friendly and helpful when booking another night. Food options were also pretty nice. Overall the whole family enjoyed the stay and we have no complaints.

title: Great Moxy Agent
text: Curtis was an exceptional travel agent! He was incredibly friendly, and his assistance was immediate. We felt truly supported throughout our planning. His expertise made our trip planning seamless. Definitely coming back to him for our next journey!

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC MUST VISIT
text: Our son goes to NYU and we stay in this hotel almost every week. The place is amazing and Bernie is the bomb. It is a great location and includes free, continental breakfast and dry cleaning and the people are amazing. Trust me you will not regret staying here. We are platinum for life and this is our go to.

title: Amazing Stay at the Moxy…
text: My stay was incredibly cool. The front desk staff at the LES location Victor, Steph and Kimberly made my stay the funniest and most entertaining visit to New York. And I wasn’t even there for fun! I was there in a business trip. Their detail to attention, specially the manager, is what made my stay great. At the end, it still a Moxy, my room was small with no workspace area, but, I had already read it at the moment of booking the room. title: Good stay.
text: Fantastic stay at this hotel! Impeccable service, cozy rooms, and great amenities. Highly recommend for a comfortable and enjoyable experience. "The staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Convenient location too! Will definitely return on our next visit."

title: Thumbs up!
text: The service was fantastic.  Checked in with Curtis and Alex and they were very friendly and accommodating.  I felt very welcomed to their establishment after flying all night.  We got a great room and the property is beautiful and very stylish.   May not be the best place for families as it very popular with the young hip crowd. Rooms small but they made the most of the space with a lot of nice futures such as a holdup descend cubbies below the beds.  otherwise, very comfortable with nice coffee breakfast downstairs,  nice restaurants,  great location by little Italy, Chinatown , close to east village.  Enjoyed our experience.

title: Sean is the best
text: Sean is the most amazing person. And Alex too. But Sean is truly a treasure and should be promoted he is very genial and attentive and makes every guest feel like they're coming home from a long trip. If you could hire more people like Sean this business would be soaring.

title: Very nightcluby at the weekends in the lobby but had a good stay
text:
We arrived on a Friday night and it’s like entering a nightclub- the music was too loud in the lobby- hard to speak with or hear the front desk person (I’m mid-40s and hearing works fine!) I get it that they are going for a very vibey type of hotel, but it’s just too much. My older generation relatives would have walked in and walked straight out! It comes across as a nightclub first, and hotel second.
Comfortable beds for my daughter and I, however, we are 5”4 and 5”6 and we both found the beds very short. My feet hung over the end of the bed, so I don’t know how the beds are meant to accommodate a taller person. 
Great location. Short walk to subway station with direct subway line that wizzes you uptown in minutes. Short walk to cool delis (Russ & daughter) and bars, and famous Katz deli. Short walk to little Italy’s Mulberry Street cool shops/cafes of Spring St and Soho. The Japanese restaurant in the basement had excellent (but v pricey) food. 
Breakfast spread consisted of croissants, pain au chocolat, pots of yoghurt, small bottles of juice and coffee. It was ok but was often picked over by 9.15am and poorly replenished. Free bottle of water in the room would have been nice, as would a mini fridge. Small room (we had a 2 bed city view) which meant that our two large suitcases had to be zipped up and upright or stepped in on way to/from window. 
A/C heating worked well. 
Good shower pressure. I wasn’t asked about my stay at check out but we had a good stay and no complaints.

title: I’ll be back
text: The service I experienced at the Moxy Hotel surpassed all expectations. Kimberly and Steph went above and beyond to ensure every detail of my stay was perfect. Their warmth, professionalism, and attention to detail truly made a difference and made me feel incredibly valued as a guest.

title: Great customer service
text: We had to check in super late with friends coming in from the West Coast. Alex and Curtis who were both working at the front counter were the best, super helpful at a late hour to get us checked in and make sure we felt taken care of. Great customer service.

title: Excellent location good rooms and very good helpful staff!
text: Two outstanding employees who made our stay super comfortable and nice were Stephi and Kim they helped us with early check ins and overall made the experience extraordinary. title: 10/10 will be coming back!
text:
I was staying at the MOXY for a girls trip and had the best time with the staff! Kim and the manager who helped us get a reservation at an amazing restaurant close by and helped change a reservation we had at another MOXY that was supposed to be here (my bad!) were super helpful!

10/10 will be coming back for the vibe and people

title: Great vacation
text: The Moxy was such a nice experience from the minute we arrived. The front desk guy Bernie was so helpful with any accommodations we needed and would help us carry our luggage. The  hotel is nice for Ang special event or just for a relaxing weekend would highly recommend to anyone.

title: Good night in the LES
text:
I stayed at the Moxy for one night for a show at the very close-by Bowery Ballroom (literally a 2 minute walk).

The room was small, as are most in NYC.  No closets or dressers, no luggage rack that I could find, so put my bag on the one chair in the room.  It would have been very tight if I was with someone else in the room though.  The bed was comfortable and everything was very clean.  The bathroom sink is in the room and the shower and toilet are each behind separate sliding doors, which is a bit of an odd setup. 

My one night’s sleep was really quiet even being quite close to the elevator.  I heard no traffic noise or noise from other guests.  

There is a $30 destination fee charged upon check-in.  You can use this to offset drinks and food in the bar and coffee shop.  I kind of felt compelled to use the $30 just because otherwise it was wasted money to me.  I got in too late for bar drinks so had breakfast, which was passable and not really worth $30.  I’d rather have gone out for a bagel and coffee somewhere else rather than have a cold croissant and yogurt.

The plusses outweighs the minuses though and I’d probably return if I had events in the area again.

text:

Overall, my experience at this hotel was superb and highly recommend it to others. While the hotel itself was awesome, I would be remiss if I didn’t mention one of the most professional, kind, and accommodating staff members, Jade.

title: Amazing hotel, amazing staff!
text:
My family and I stayed at the Moxy East Side over the past few days (Thursday-Sundays). We had such an amazing time and the staff was just as amazing. They were pleasant and polite the moment we arrived. I cannot say enough about Ms. Jade who was extremely attentive, courteous, and exemplified professionalism during our entire stay. 

The hotel was clean and bar/lounge area was cozy and accommodating to our large group. I had a corner room on the 12th floor with an AMAZING view of the city. We celebrated my father’s birthday at the hotel’s restaurant, which was fantastic.

I HIGHLY recommend this hotel! In fact, I plan to return this summer!

title: Had a lot of fun
text:
This hotel may not be for everyone, but I really enjoyed it.  The Moxy brand from Marriott is somewhat inconsistent with some of the locations offering very basic services and other offering a variety of bars, restaurants, etc.  The Moxy NYC Lower East Side is part of the group offering more to do. The bars including the rooftop bar and the lobby bar were great and fun.  There is also a sushi restaurant and piano bar but I did not try either of these. 

The rooms themselves are comfortable but very small.  I was traveling solo with a smaller rolling suitcase and there simply was no place to put the luggage.  There was a drawer under the bed but if you were to store your luggage there it would be difficult to access.  The shower was great and my room had a good view uptown.  The windows opened slightly but when you closed them it was very quiet.  The hotel also offers a free continental breakfast that is more than satisfactory and there is a cafe if you need more.

The hotel staff are all 1st class and helpful.  The hotel charges a $30 destination fee that includes a $30 credit per day at the lobby bar or cafe on the lobby level and a $30 per day laundry credit.  At first I was somewhat annoyed, but I was able to use my credits at the bar and get a short laundered.

One last note:  this area is up and coming but still a little rough around the edges. I found it totally safe, especially during the day, but you need to be conscious of the area.  On the plus side, you have some great food options close by including Chinatown, Little Italy, and the Lower East Side for bagels + lox, knishes, and corned beef sandwiches.  It is also a quick 15 minute walk to SoHo and maybe 20 minutes to Greenwich Village.

title: Amazing experience
text: There are many things I enjoyed about my stay. As a safety feature it brought me peace of mind to know only hotel staff and guest had access to the elevators. title: Amazing group stay!

title: Let The Good Times Roll.
text:
The Moxy sits on the Bowery (remember the Bowery Boys) and is bounded by NYC's buzzy Soho & Little Italy. My King Court View was a tad small weighting in at 165 sq. ft. and adorned with pops of red in an open plan concept that encompassed a vanity. The room featured a sleek headboard, below bed luggage shelf, small chair next to a fold-out desk/table. My shower and toilet was separately encased in cool colored patterned glass. The Moxy has a bevy of eating/drinking venues. The Fix offers a selection of grab-n-go items from a lobby coffee bar. Th e Silver Lining Lounge is a piano bar with great entertainment and serves up great cocktails like the Violet Underground, a concoction that I relished more than once. A subterranean Japanese restaurant, Sake No Hana, is the source of culinary delights. Black Truffle-laced Soup, King Crab Salad and the like grace the menu..........while my selection of Spicy Tuna Sushi was the best. The Highlight Room is an all weather rooftop bar.

So, if rooftop & piano bars, a destination Japanese restaurant, uniquely designed rooms, a price point favorable hotel are you desire....................then try the.....................
Moxy Lower East Side...................let the good times rolls.

title: 14th floor noise
text:
make sure when you check in you are aware that there’s a nightclub on the 16th floor that goes till 4am and loud noise can affect your stay if you are situated on the 14th floor 

I was in a business trip and had an early start next morning - around 12:30am the music on 14th floor and room became too loud to sleep. At 1am I called reception to complain, at 1.30am an associate came to my room to observed the noise, and agreed that the noise as too loud. At 2am the music volume was finally turned down and i could sleep (from 2am to 5:30am)

If you are there to enjoy a vacation that’s different  - for me having to get up after 3 hours sleep was a real issue and really affected my day 

I would ask the hotel to make enquiries at check in if you are there for business so that you can enjoy a full nights sleep on a lower floor

The sink was in the room and I was ok with that, but it was difficult to even wash your hands without touching the sink surface or the faucet. The bed was comfortable. The shower was great size. The toilet area was tight. The location was great. The crowd was very hip. The coffee shop was a hit and the bartender was awesome. I did check out and was told my bill would be emailed. I wasn’t worried, because we prepaid everything, including fees and resort fees before we even arrived. When it didn’t come, I called the hotel and was told the business office would be mailed to me as they charged me $280.00. I never received it. I contacted them through social media - Facebook messenger and no response. I still have no idea what I was charged for, but I should have disputed it with my card. I felt that the hotel was reputable and would take care of it though. Unfortunately they have not!

text:
I planned a surprise trip to NYC for my husband, and we had such an amazing experience! The Moxie is beyond gorgeous. It’s such a vibe and very edge,  it’s new and clean. It’s close to everything! Great walking distance to everything nearby and easy subway access as well. 

We took the redeye from the west coast and ended up arriving a little earlier than our check-in time at 8 AM.  We were greeted by the wonderful Sydney. The entire staff during our stay there was absolutely excellent and kind. She and everyone else was so cheerful and warm - indeed the start to an amazing trip!

I explained to Sydney that we were early and hoping to get in earlier so we could get some sleep if possible. She was able to find us a room that wasn’t our room just so we could lay down for about two hours. Our angel! She was then able to upgrade us to an is even larger suite that made our stay even more magical. We had an amazing view of the city with an amazing room. We will definitely be staying here again during our next visit- 1000 out of 100 recommendation! For the hotel, Sydney and the entire staff!

text: Great experience, trendy, great view., love the breakfast.  Stylish hotel which attracts cool people. Great value as well. Try to get a room with the view - it is worth it. Rooms are relatively small, but it is well compensated by stylish design and ergonomics

title: What a pleasant surprise!
text:
I booked this hotel with my husband on a whim as we were coming to NYC to visit my sick mother in law at a nearby hospital. 

When we arrived, I was pleasantly surprised at the atmosphere and all that the hotel had on site; a coffee shop, cocktail bar, work and hang space, piano bar, rooftop bar, fitness center, and a Japanese restaurant downstairs called Sake No Hana. We had not realized when booking that the hotel had so much to offer! It’s like a resort in the Lower East Side. 

The hotel decor and ambiance is lovely - funky but classy. The location and proximity to many restaurants and shopping, SoHo, Nolita, Little Italy, is prime. The front desk staff and everyone else throughout the hotel is friendly and seem to really enjoy their job working here.  

The rooms are very clean, new, and stylish. The pillows, sheets, and beds are very comfortable. Only complaint I have is the lighting system (they need to figure out a way to be able to turn each light on separately as it seems you can only turn on the entire set of lights together or none at all). 

We ended up having to stay a couple more nights and the manager Joshua was extremely nice and able to accommodate us last minute.

Thank you Moxy and Team for making our stay so enjoyable during such a difficult time in our lives. We are grateful to have had this place to call home base. We won’t ever stay anywhere else in NYC except here! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Recent / clean / good location yet improvable on noise and clarity.
text: Recent  / clean / good location.  The lobby is much too noisy in the late afternoon, and you hardly can hear what the reception team says. The check-in is quick and efficient. We booked a room on the 10th floor to make sure not to hear to the lobby music (and it was a wise decision). The room is small, yet well organized. The air con can be stopped but you still have this permanent noise of ventilation, not to talk about the noise of showers of the neighboors. So, we paid more to be at the 10th floor, but had to use earplugs because of this constant noise... All the features of the room are simple but enough and smart. The credit you have for breakfast (30$) can not be cumulated (in order to spend more one day, less the other day). But the quality of food and drinks is good per se, although there was no fruit.  The window, though at the 10th floor, is not large (compared to the nearby M Gallery, where all windows, whatever the category of the room are very large...). If we were to come back, we would try the M Gallery. Ventilation noise + narrow window makes it too expensive for what it is (total for 3 nights booked 8 weeks in advance= 500$ / night). The area is great, Spring street and Soho district are always magic. NB: the platinum Marriott card made no difference....

title: Moxy Hotel Lower East Side: A Capitalist's Paradise with Caroline's Charisma and Free Popcorn
text:
Well, let me tell you about my stay at the Moxy Hotel Lower East Side. It's like stepping into a hipster's dream, folks. Now, when it comes to hospitality, I gotta give a shoutout to Caroline, the queen of charisma at this joint. She greeted me with a smile that could charm the cynicism out of a grizzled capitalist.

But let's not forget the free popcorn, people! I mean, I'm no expert, but free popcorn is like a warm hug from the universe, reminding you that there's still a flicker of kindness left in this brutal capitalist world. It's like a small act of rebellion against the corporate machine. You walk in, get your popcorn, and think, "Yeah, I'm sticking it to the capitalist!"

Now, don't get me wrong, capitalism has its place, but it can be a ruthless beast. Yet, here at the Moxy, they sprinkle a bit of generosity amid the cold, hard cash. It's a sanctuary of comfort amidst the concrete jungle, and that, my friends, is something to be celebrated.

So, if you're looking for a slice of quirky luxury in the heart of the Lower East Side, with Caroline's warm welcome and a side of free popcorn, then the Moxy Hotel is your oasis in this dog-eat-dog capitalist world. It's a little haven of humanity amidst the chaos, and it gets a nod of approval from this wise-cracking traveler.

title: Tiny and Terrible.
text:
Over my many years on this planet, I’ve found my biggest frustration in life is when form takes over function or, when applied to a hotel; style over practicality.  Unfortunately the Moxy is one of the worst example of this.

The hotel is brand new which means everything is shiny and new, however my room, a Double King with city view is tiny. I’ve stayed in bigger police cells than this and they are generally better designed as well. I’ve stayed in tiny hotel rooms before, but they’ve been sold as such and have been cleverly designed to maximize every inch of space, alas not the Moxy.

On entering the room you are first assaulted by the sink unit unceremoniously dumped in the entrance hallway. Some half-witted designer, who has clearly never stayed in a hotel before, thinks it’s a great idea to combine the bathroom with the entrance lobby - yes really. I went to unpack my case and was pleased to find the put-up case stand thing that most hotels have, but one problem; there isn’t enough floor space anywhere in the room to put it up, so dumping my case on the bed, I looked for the wardrobe; this doesn’t exist either, it’s three coat hangers dangling beneath the TV, and they are fixed so you can’t even take them off.

Like many business travellers I’m a simple person with only a couple of requirements; somewhere to work, coffee to drink and a hot shower. Once again the Moxy fails on all counts. 

What claims to be a desk is a 2’ square flap that drops down from the wall coupled with a very small, extremely uncomfortable stall. The stall is good for about ten minutes before it kills your back and as the flap is only just laptop sized, you’re knackered if you want to do anything else on it.

In 2023, why don’t all US hotels have a coffee making facility? All UK and European hotels do, it’s been a standard for as long as I can remember. I understand why the posh hotels don’t because they expect you to call room service and have it delivered, but the Moxy doesn’t have room service. I asked at the bar at 4pm if they served coffee and the bartender laughed at me. He then pointed me to the nearest Starbucks, a mere 20 minutes walk away. 

The shower and toilet in my minuscule accommodation consist of two cubicles with sliding doors. The shower works well although it’s only an overhead unit, but the challenge comes when leaving the shower. There’s nowhere to hang your towel in the shower itself so you have to leave the cubicle and step back into the lobby come bathroom space. Compared to the shower, this is freezing, so not only is the Moxy a lousy hotel, it’s likely to give you a bout of pneumonia as well. Once you’ve finished drying off, guess what? Absolutely nowhere to now hang your wet towel.

And so I go to bed. The Moxy features a number of entertainment spaces one of which is a nightclub. I’m not sure where it is, but the bass from the music thumps through the building till 2am. 

It wouldn’t be right to review the hotel without mentioning the location. I won’t go into too much detail, but my advice is to hide your wallet, walk as fast as you can and don’t venture out after dark.

All in all the Moxy is lousy. If it was cheap, you could forgive some of this, but it’s not it’s top dollar in its category. My advice; unless you want to be bound up like a battery chicken in an egg farm, fancy a dose of pneumonia or enjoying playing ‘name that tune’ in the early hours of the morning; stay somewhere else.

title: Nice hotel for the price
text:
Beautiful hotel in the lower east side, here are some of our thoughts. 

The hotel is beautiful and modern. First impressions are this is a very nice, new trendy place to stay.  That being said it was also one of the more affordable places to stay in the lower east side. The customer service was fine and as a Bonvoy member we had a 30 dollar a day credit which we didn’t use (more on that later). We saw a commercial on the flight to NYC for The Moxy that if you checked in at the bar you would get a complimentary drink. The Bartender nor the receptionist knew of this which I thought was strange being there were commercials on JetBlue showing young people checking in at the bar and getting a drink. 

The elevators are a bit of a mess when it’s busy. You have to swipe your card and it picks the elevator, cars 1, 2 and 3. If there’s a line it can get frustrating. Otherwise it’s fine. 

The room itself was a partial city view at 210 sq Ft. We knew it was going to be small which was fine. Just beware theres not much room for luggage. The shower and the toilet were separate which was nice…the sink was inside the room itself. No drawers so nothing is hidden. There’s a funky metal contraption around the tv with hangers to hang your clothing. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were really soft which I would have preferred firmer. The room was quiet so I did get a good nights sleep so that was definitely a plus being they do have a club and rooftop bar. 

The rooftop bar was nice and we went for happy hour. The space was airy and beautiful. We chose to sit inside being it was really windy on the terrace. I had two five dollar glasses of Rose and my husband had two beers. We ordered a mushroom truffle pizza which was to die for! We couldn’t use our 30 dollar a day credit here which was a minus being that this is the only place we spent money at while in the hotel. 

Overall it was a good experience, I will stay again but only for short trips anything more than 3 nights we would need larger accommodations. We happened to be traveling with backpacks so it worked out just fine.

I was a little worried when we checked in because our room was tiny (known before check-in) and right beside the elevator bank on our floor. I was convinced we'd be hearing noisy guests all night long. Spoiler alert -- this was one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed in. We never heard noise above us and only once did we hear people in the hall. Also, we heard no street noise (likely because our room faced a courtyard). 

The team was so attentive. Any requests, and we had quite a few, were quickly and graciously taken care of. 

I loved the vibe of the property. All four of us loved the bed linens (on our way home, we purchased a set for our home). Upon check-in, the room was uber clean. For 5 nights, I would've preferred getting our linens changed at least once. We didn't quite get the rhythm of housekeeping. They came in (didn't change the linens) and spruced up 2 or 3 times during our stay, but not daily. However, it's very important to note that they would bring additional towels and pull trash upon request without problem.

Not a huge fan of the property's location, but that was my bad on not doing enough research. If you're visiting NYC to do all the touristy things, be prepared to spend more money on ride shares or the subway.

title: Fits together like a jigsaw !
text: First off, the service from every member of the Crew we encountered was excellent - unfussy, ‘on it’, engaging and ‘can do’. Great eye contact and lots of smiles. Secondly, ‘Grand St’ and ‘Bowery’ subways are both less than 2 minutes walk…and from these, the 9/11 Museum for example is circa 10 minutes, midtown Manhattan circa 15 minutes. And a critical tip for those new to NYC is doing proper research on how the subways work ! Over 5 days, the numbered routes relative to the colours and capital letters were anathema. Too often we took pot luck, despite asking supposed Locals in the know ! But back to the hotel… First impressions and ‘quirky’ is an adjective that comes to mind ( with not necessarily totally positive connotations  !? ). The Lobby is dark and the feel is ( perhaps ?! ) a blend of bohemian, art deco, minimalist… There’s nothing Corporate about the place but outside of work, that’s necessarily a good thing. I laughed when I read the word ‘creepy’ being used by a earlier Reviewer to describe the ‘feel’. That’s not something we felt, albeit the lifts were unnecessarily dark & dingy. The rooms are what Marketeers might call ‘bijoux’. I’d suggest ‘small, tight, purposeful and comfortable’. Everything within them fits together like a jigsaw. Whilst a cat can be swung, don’t expect to increase your daily steps doing laps around the perimeter. But the beds are super comfortable, everything is spotlessly clean, the shower’s great and the request for an in-room kettle was willingly accommodated and definitely handy ! In summary, this is a confident recommendation.

title: absurd but not stylish
text:
I have taken long-distance train trips in sleeper compartments, where you accept compact facilities in exchange for the ever-changing scenery and being able to sleep while being transported to your destination. Well, the Moxy LES was just like that, except for the ever-changing scenery or being transported to a destination. In short, it had all the cons and none of the pros.

This hotel was clearly designed by someone whose towering artistic genius would not be constrained by such mundane things as customer comfort or convenience. The elevator area is cramped. The corridors are narrow, as well as dark and creepy---reminded me of the cheap old NYC hotels I stayed in in my misspent youth. The undersized rooms contain oversized beds, leaving little space for such plebian things as hanging up your clothing or being able to access your luggage without kneeling. The sink is about four inches deep, so water bounces out of it. The lobby area has mismatched and uncomfortable furniture, adding to the flophouse vibe.

Their web page says the hotel is "a stylish play on the absurd". Well, it's no Pirandello stage set; but many of the design choices are clearly absurd. All of this would be fine if the small room sizes came with correspondingly small prices. However, even allowing for the NYC location, this hotel is not cheap. We foolishly paid extra for a corner room with view. Indeed we got exactly that, but we thought a corner room would have views in two directions. We were wrong...one side just looks at other rooms of this hotel. They kept their curtains drawn, and so did we. 

The $30 resort fee is another stylish play on the absurd. It had to be used for overpriced coffee and croissants each morning when we could have had much nicer breakfasts a couple of blocks in any direction. They don't give you receipts, so even though we spent less than $30 each morning, a charge for more than $30 appeared on our bill. It was only a few dollars more so we didn't fight it, and we had no proof anyway. We just resolved not to stay here again.

title: Great location. Disappointing rooms
text:
Amazing location but unfortunately below average rooms.

Me and my girlfriend stayed 6 nights in an Executive Room with city view. The view was breathtaking and just what we had hoped for and the location of the hotel could not be any better when looking forward to walk around in NYC

I know Moxy is not 5 star but unfortunately the room lacked many (completely) basic things that it started to annoy us after just 24 hours.

There is no place in the room for your clothes, so we had 6 days with open suitcases on the floor. No closets. No drawers. And just two hangers (for two people staying 6 nights). I have never experienced this before no matter where in the world I have traveled including 3 other trips to NYC.

There is no fridge/mini bar in the room, so you can not keep anything refrigerated (???). So we had no cold drinks in our room. This I have also never experienced before. We asked for a fridge in the recepetion and they delivered an old fridge to our room the next day.

There is only an overhead shower so no hand shower. Why not both?

There is no place to hang the towels near the sink, so when you need a towel you have to walk around with wet hands. This might sound like a tiny issue but after a couple of days this is just plain stupid.

There is only one bin in the room placed by the toilet. Maybe it would be nice with a bin in the room also?

It would also be really nice to be able to dim the light. All the lamps and lights in the room only have one setting. Moxy Lower East Side is a fairly new hotel so a dimmer would also be quite fair to hope for.

I know some of these things might not seem important at all. Who really cares about a bin in the room? Or a place to hang the towels near the sink? Normally I wouldn't care. And if it was only one of these things that lacked then it would not be a problem, but accumulated these things just make no sense at all and unfortunately ads to a negative experience.

I know Moxy is doing great work on their interior design (just like many other hotels), but fixing the above issues would not in any way interfere with the cool interior. I have seen it work perfectly in many other hotels around the world.

They take care of everything and have bar, piano bar and nightclub. I stay under the club and I don’t hear it so don’t worry about it.

title: Just Wonderful
text: Fantastic hotel. Fantastic location. Great staff. They are doing it right. Thanks to DJ and the entire team for making sure my experience was wonderful. Check in was a breeze and room was cool, clean and just what I was looking for for a solo stay. Can’t go wrong here.

title: A wonderful hotel in the heart of the LES
text: Leidy and Kim were wonderful, kind and beautiful people. Clean and  modern rooms with proper amenities. Very glad this hotel allows you to connect your streaming platforms to tour TV! Thank you for making this a positive experience!!! :)

title: Moxy was great!
text: Leidy was amazing ! She was really intentional about making sure the process to get a room extended was seamless. When I got here they even gave me a room upgrade. Jess and another young man with braids was also awesome.

title: GREAT staff and even BETTER manager! You won’t regret your stay 😃
text: This was my first time staying at a boutique hotel, and I was somewhat nervous, to be completely honest. But there aren’t enough words to describe how much I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. From the moment we arrived all the staff were very welcoming and warm. The BEST part was Demario, one of the managers. He made it a point to make sure that my sister and I were comfortable and well taken care of. He full of so much knowledge about the city and gave great suggestions for things to do/visit in the area. All in all he made our trip so memorable and I am so grateful! I will most definitely be coming back!

title: Great hotel!
text: Great location in LES and nothing like the most hotels I have stayed at in Europe. We stayed in a double double room with city view on the 8th floor, room is compact but beds are comfy and the room was very bright with corner exposure and views all the way to Hudson yards. Staff was friendly at all times, Yima and Yasira helped us remain in the same room avoiding tedious check-in check-out although we had two separate reservations for our 5-day stay. Complimentary drip coffee from stumptown in the am is a very nice touch. Will definitely come back!

title: My Favorite MOXY - so far
text:
I've now stayed at all of the Moxy's in NYC and I think I like this one the best.  Although they are all great.  Reception is easy and friendly. There is complimentary coffee in the lobby as well as a Bar in the evening.  There's even a Piano Bar.  The Japanese Restaurant downstairs is Excellent.
And the rooftop bar is classy. As for the rooms - yes they area on the small side however they are so well appointed that after a few minutes you don't even notice the size. Our room had floor to ceiling windows and a great view. The staff is great and friendly. All in all a great time was had and I got to know a neighborhood I wasn't really familiar with and now am crazy about. Can't wait for the LA MOXY to open!

title: A Marriott for the 20-30 year olds
text: We always stay at Marriott’s, and can depend on great staff, clean rooms, etc. so we thought we would try the newer version MOXY.  well designed and efficient, small rooms great coffee and small café downstairs and a nice bar.  Piano bar and Japanese restaurants on location. Very safe and secure. The negative- the smell of weed permeates, the halls and rooms, scratchy wax paper like toilet paper no lotion, towel sets were not fully stocked each day even when I asked. Make sure to request a higher room as sometimes you can hear the band playing downstairs.

title: Samambaia
text: It’s a very nice place, we feel like home! The atendants are very nice and atencious, the manager grave us all the suport we needed in doubt moments. We’ll surelly be back soon! Very nice place, only good vibes!

title: Yas deserves a raise ♥️
text: Yas provided the best service for my friends and I. Both Rooms were ready early, personality is A1, and she was able to accommodate with the rooms being near each other. I’m gonna tell all my friends and fam about Moxy LES.

title: Yas is the best!!!
text: Yas is the best!!! She made the check in experience seamless for us. Upon arrival, we were greeted by her and the entire team which was so welcoming. Will be back for sure just for the stay and the fabulous team!

title: Business trip - Leidy experience
text: I had yet another amazing stay at The Moxy LES! Such a beautiful hotel. The service all around was fantastic.  Leidy, the hotel manager and her staff is incredible during every moment of my stay. Above and beyond as always!

title: A perfect hotel for a fun trip with friends
text: We loved our stay at The Moxy. Edwin and Curtis both went above and beyond to make sure we had a pleasant check-in and check-out, and we enjoyed every moment we spent in the hotel. The rooftop bar is beautiful and we took advantage of the generous 5-9 happy hour. The room was spotless and well-designed to look great and function well, even with four adults staying in a double room. Also, the pillows are sensational. Will absolutely stay at The Moxy again. Thank you!

title: Great Service & personnel
text:
Victor at the front desk was super helpful, with check in & some business needs for a meeting.
Great service, conversation and everything .
He Checked in with our teams over the course of our stay making sure we were set! Quality 100%

title: A+++++++++
text: Can't say enough about how great our stay was at Moxy Lower East Side! Check in/out was simple with the friendliest staff. Room is small but efficient. Spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. We had drinks at the lobby bar which was fun, trendy and vibrant. Next was dinner at Sake No Hana. DO NOT MISS this restaurant! It is a beautiful space and the service was second to none. The food was DELICIOUS!!!!!! We topped off our night at Silver Linings Piano Bar. Again, stunning decor, beautiful people, fantastic service and extremely talented entertainment. Truly can't wait to go back!!!

title: 5 star stay!!
text: Great, hip hotel. Although small, room was clean and comfortable. Bed was so comfortable!! Drinks in hotel bar were delicious. Restaurant Sake no Hana in hotel was amazing!! Food was delicious and servers so attentive. Loved Silver Linings piano bar. Great entertainment, beautiful bar and beautiful crowd. Drinks and service were great. Coffee and light bites in morning in lobby. We would definitely stay there again!! Hotel has it all. You really don’t need to leave. Can’t wait to go back!

title: Incredible weekend stay!
text: The hotel was upbeat, modern and cool. Great vibe! Bed was very comfortable. Room was extremely clean and hotel staff very attentive and accommodating.  We loved dining at the Sake No Hana restaurant and drinks at Silver Lining was an amazing experience!  Great stay overall! Highly recommend this NYC stylist chic boutique hotel!

title: 10/10 Atmosphere and Great Service
text: Would highly recommend it. They have a great bar with an excellent atmosphere. I came to visit friends and we hung out in the hotel bar and had a great time. The location is perfect and the staff is extremely attentive, more so than I am used to at hotels.

title: Not a welcoming place
text: The front desk service was atrocious. They did not accommodate any request and had zero flexibility around check in. It was almost like a customer paying 500 a night was a bother to them. The hotel has some cool features but the attitude is impossible to overcome.

title: Very clean & modern
text:
The hotel was very clean. We stayed for three nights and our towels were changed and room cleaned. The reception area was very cool. No issues checking in and out. Tax hadn’t been added to our booking so ended up costing more than we thought. 
The room was small. There was four of us in one room but as we’re all close, it was no issue to us.

title: The Lower East Side Moxy’s great staff!
text: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Lower East Side Moxy.  We were in NY to celebrate a special birthday for my wife and the hotel staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly.  I would like to especially mention Yirma, who really made our trip special.  Yirma told us that she would make our room welcoming, and she did.  She put colorful balloons through the room and wrote cheerful happy birthday notes on the mirrors to celebrate my wife’s big day.  We had no idea what she was going to do so we were not only surprised but touched by her efforts and kindness.  Yirma’s thoughtfulness and extra effort was  throughly appreciated by us and truly helped make that special day even more memorable.  In particular, because of the extra effort that Yrima went to ensure that our stay was perfect, we will definitely return to the Lower East Side Moxy.  Moreover, whenever friends travel to NYC, we will suggest staying at the LES Moxy!  Thank you for helping to make our big celebration wonderful!!

title: Most was a vibe! It was so cool! Kimberly was especially kind! The staff was so welcoming and happy!
text:
Moxy was a vibe! From the moment you are greeted at the door to walking into the impeccably designed lobby and speaking to the kind front desk staff. The location was perfect! I loved everything about it!
Their cafe was awesome,  everything about the hotel  was quality!

title: Great hotel!
text: Awesome hotel, great vibe. Rooms are a little small but hey it’s NYC! Love the decor and the way they make use of the space. Great location just north of Chinatown but with many great spots within walking distance. Checked in by Yirma who hooked us up with an upgrade! Will be back.

title: Best Hotel Staff Ever!
text: Had a bit of a snafu when i checked in after booking on AMEX Travel. Demario, Curtis, and Edwin helped me to get sorted and got me the room I wanted in minutes! One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had anywhere!

title: Fantastic two week stay for our startup team
text: Bedding is incredibly comfortable, Vibey bar scene, awesome views on the rooftop, amazingly helpful staff. Gym is lights out for an nyc hotel. The coffee baristas greeted us every morning, and when we wanted to be more social we had plenty of space.

title: Best spot in the LES
text: Everything was so great. Very clean, unique and fun atmosphere. The staff was so friendly and helpful, especially Luis, Vic and Yaz! We will definitely come back to this hotel the next time we are in NYC!

title: Cafe Avignon
text: Issy in the Café Avignon was incredibly kind!! She highly recommended the Pan au Chocolat and it was delicious! We also had the ham and Gruyère croissant and it was yummy too!! She went out of her way to make us feel welcome!! Thank you!!

title: Super functional - and great engineer who fixes issues!
text:
2nd stay at Moxy.  I like it.  In NYC, who needs mini-bars etc. in the room (which to be clear, Moxy does not have) - just want some place clean and functional for the night, and Moxy is that.   Rooms are quiet, clean etc.  and the coffee shop downstairs is great (pecan roll + cheese is recommended).  

This time - there was an issue with the shade in the room, and Sam the Engineer came.   Within 10 minutes of the call.  Made sure that he didn't step on the bed (very hard to access window without stepping on the bed) by doing quasi-acrobatics, and then spent 15 minutes making sure the shade was fixed properly.  Big should-out to Sam for being so thorough about it.

title: Lack of ANY in room amenities but clean and friendly.
text:
SMALL, SMALL, SMALL.  The room lacked ANY amenities in the room.   There is nowhere to hang clothes unless you count wall knobs behind door with a few hangers.  In the bath room there is nowhere to hang up towels unless you use the handicap grab bars by the toilet.  There is no iron or ironing board.  There is nowhere in bathroom for toiletries. There is nowhere to store larger luggage.  Smaller pieces can fit under the bed. If all you want is a bed, a toilet and shower, this it the place.  If you want a little more, look elsewhere. 

Outside of those issues everything is new and clean.  The staff was friendly.  Doorman gave my son and I directions to the only restaurant, within walking distance, that was still open on a Sunday night.  The empanadas were fantastic.

title: Great location and hotel!
text: My daughter and visited for a college tour and were so happy we chose the Moxy LES!  It was the perfect location to walk to all the restaurants and shopping the Lower east Side offers.  Demarius and Deshawn made our check in seamless. They had a room ready after an early morning of traveling which allowed us to relax before the tour.  Demarius made sure we had everything we needed and gave me a drink token which was a wonderful surprise.  My  teen daughter loved all the fun decor and swag the hotel offered.  The room was a perfect size and she especially loved how large the shower was.  We are returning in July with my husband and other daughter to visit the school again and we have already rebooked our stay.  Thank you so much!! Looking forward to seeing everyone again!!!

title: Just pretty good
text: Hotel was pretty good. The room was clean but very small. No closet or fridge. We had a weird experience our first morning where security came to our door and told us we were in the wrong room and had to go down to the front desk. The front desk staff acted as if we were there scamming them out of our room that we paid for when it was clearly a glitch in their system. No apology for the confusion or the time taken to get this sorted out was offered. We checked in like normal people the night before but they had us listed as being in a different room. The rooftop bar is cool. Probably would stay somewhere else next time.

title: Great new location
text:
Great location; great staff; great restauramt and great service!!!  We will come back again!
The Japanese restaurant had us irder eith 5 minutes to close and thebfood was simply divine.  Great cocktails, friendly staff, made our night even more enjoyable!  Gem here

title: My new spot in NYC!
text: I had an amazing time at the new MOXY LES! There's no where else to be. I was in town for fashion week and this was the ideal location. Having lived in NYC for 7 years you couldn't ask for a better spot. The staff was incredibly accommodating and the manager Ledy was so sweet. I look forward to returning in the near future and making it my place to stay when in NYC.

title: Front Desk Recognition
text: Deshaun from the front desk along with his team lead (we unfortunately forgot her name) were phenomenal! They provided us with exceptional service during our check in. It was our first visit to New York, and they were so informative and helpful. We really appreciate them!

title: A Lower East Side gem!!
text: A gem in the Lower East Side! This Moxy LES is a well situated hotel with amazing views, multiple food offerings and even more amazing staff (may I call out Deshawn for exceptional service)! Every staff member I have run into at this property has been upbeat and attentive, from the front door to the front desk and at the multiple food offerings. If you are thinking about getting a city view room, I will tell you right now, just do it! The views from my city view room were incredible and included both the Freedom Tower and the Empire State Building.

title: Marilyn made our stay great!
text:
The front desk staff is super friendly and accommodating, Marylin went out of her way to assist me and has excellent customer service.

The rooms are clean and comfortable with stylish decor, nice city views.

title: The moxie of Moxy!
text:
What an amazing hotel! The great vibe as soon as you walk into the lobby is palpable. Kind of a step away from the busy NYC to a more welcoming and positive environment. 

The rooms are well thought out for the space. The mattress was VERY comfy. And the restaurant, lounge, and rooftop space are like no other city I've ever been.

title: Great hotel with awesome  service from Jess and staff
text: Hotel is in great part of town and nice if small rooms.  Fun vibe.  Would stay here again.  Jess was amazing helping me get my reservation sorted out and made my trip so much better.  Thanks Jess and Moxy!

title: Amazing stay!!
text: We went the first week of March to the LES Moxy and had an amazing stay! Me and my partner were so happy we chose this location because it’s so close to Soho/Noho/Little Italy. We stayed for a few days and everyone provided a great service during our stay. We were really tired the fist day due to some flight delays but upon arrival the front desk girl Kimberly put a smile on our face. She was very kind and made sure everything went smoothly as we already had a chaotic flight. Overall, my experience was great and will definitely come back if I fly back to NY.

title: Best service!
text: Demario is the best!! I got to the hotel way too early and he got me checked in and upgraded as soon as I got there! He made sure I had everything I needed and gave me a free drink token, I will absolutely be coming back. Give Demario a raise!!

title: A great hotel with an amazing staff and service
text:
I’m a big fan of the Moxy hotels in general. For the uninitiated, they’re trendy, fun, and quirky. The lobby feels more like a dance club than a hotel lobby. 
The Moxy on the lower east side tops them all for their amazing service. From the door man, to the front desk staff, to the lobby bar, and to the coffee shop, everyone is so friendly. 
The rooms are clean with good amenities and the keyed elevator system makes my family feel safe. 
A special shout out to Marilyn for being so accommodating to my family. I love you for making us feel so welcome and making it possible to get a good night’s sleep! If you’re ever in the greater Houston area, you will be welcome in my home.

title: Great location, solid staff, comfortable stay
text: The property is centrally located within a blocks' distance from two metro lines that can get you downtown or midtown in under 15 minutes. The accommodations are quite comfortable, clean, with a cool/modern style that is quite unique. The rooms are very quiet and private with very little to no noise coming from the busy streets of New York. The staff are amazing, going above and beyond to foster the best stay/experience possible. From check in to check out and in between, I had an opportunity to interact with Kimberly, whose pleasant demeanor and welcoming attitude made me feel I was staying at a much higher tier property. Kudos to the leadership team at this location for their hires and support. I will definitely be staying again at this location next time I visit NYC.

title: NYC Exploration
text: We had a great stay. The location is great for exploring Little Italy, Chinatown and the surrounding areas. We look forward to coming back soon. Nicole S. (Nikki) was very helpful and professional. The entire facility and staff were excellent.

title: Great setup and location
text:
I’ve stayed at a few different Moxy hotels in Eur and US, and I’d say this one is the best setup. I used to live in the area, so coming back and staying here was great and feels integrated right into the neighborhood.

Good cafe in the lobby w best coffee in the neighborhood and good little breakfast items to grab. Awesome piano Lounge connected to hotel and hotel guest can get priority reservations before a certain time, which was huge bc by 10:30p each night the piano lounge was full, and was good crowd and fun atmosphere for relaxed live music. 

Staff was great, and want to call out Yirma at front desk specifically, who helped me a few times and gave me the inside scoop on how the different venues worked and the food/bev credit worked. Will def be back.

title: Great place, excellent service, perfect location.
text: Wonderful service, from the moment we arrived, Kim and Steph welcomed us with a smile and excellent disposition. very friendly and efficient. I love the service and the person who opens the door is always very friendly and smiling. very good location and service recommend moxy lower east side. Clean, safe, great service and great location.

title: SO MUCH TO LOVE!
text: There's always a feeling of magic and whimsy when you walk into a Moxy hotel...this Lower East Side location is no exception. This was my second time staying at the Moxy Lower East Side. The first was back in October right after they opened. And while I had a great experience then, it's very cool to stay here now with all amenities - including the restaurant and rooftop bar - fully open. The Moxy staff couldn't have been friendlier, greeting and welcoming me as soon as I walked in. Check in was easy and efficient. Like other Moxy locations in NYC, the elevators are secure and require key card access - a feature I love since I regularly travel solo. I was in a King City View room and IT. WAS. STUNNING! Not only was the room spotless, spacious, well-appointed and thoughtfully laid out, it had a spectacular view of the city. Watching the sunset from my room each night was a dream and I even got lucky enough to see it snow one evening which I enjoyed from the comfort and coziness of my room. Super plush and comfortable bed and linens. Fantastic water pressure in the shower. Very hip and fun neighborhood to explore if you're looking for that. Fully equipped gym so it's super easy to stay on track while traveling. There really is SO MUCH TO LOVE about this hotel. I'll definitely be back!

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Great hotel and even better staff! Big shout out to Jess and Vic for making the stay amazing !! The hotel is new and clean and the views of the city were awesome. I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

title: Yas and Yirma rock!!!
text:
Yas and Yirma were absolutely incredible from the moment I stepped in.
They allowed me to use the shower as I arrived early. They also gave nice upgrade in appreciation of my Bonvoy status. 
The vibe in this property is truly amazing and I would recommend to everyone visiting the big apple.

title: Loved the Lower East Side MOXY!
text: We stayed 5 nights and had an excellent stay!  Everyone we interacted with from the doormen to the bartenders to the service team were outstanding!  I do have to call out the delightful coffee baristas in the morning cafe, Isha and Esther...they were consistently friendly and helpful!  The area is wonderful too...many places to eat nearby and would definitely recommend this place for future visits!

title: Wonderful stay at the Moxy LOE!
text: Such a beautiful, lively and trendy hotel. Conveniently located and overall the staff was accommodating. I arrived in the morning after taking a red eye and Demario was able to get me into my room with an amazingly early check in. Curtis was awesome and held my bags before my room was ready so I could enjoy a quick spin class down the road. Everyone was friendly, and made me feel relaxed after a long night of travel. Definitely will stay again!

title: Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Staff, Perfect 2 Night Stay
text:
Found my new favorite NYC hotel! I'm a Marriott Titanium level and have stayed at other Moxy properties before so the room here was a familiar concept- on the smaller end, very smart storage and clever design on how to fit everything. The hotel has a lot of common space to sit and relax if you are looking for a little more space to work. 

Loved that  the rooms here are so clean and the design is brand new and beautiful.  The underbed storage is huge and has a small safe included. What truly stands out is the customer service. Everyone went above and beyond to make this stay excellent and that's the reason I will be back for sure. Our room was ready early and as a member they did provide a complimentary upgrade. The lobby bar was the perfect place to relax & all 3 venues we got to try were fantastic: Sake No Hana, The Silver Lining Lounge and the Highlight Room rooftop. 

The location is incredible, you have so much going on in either direction of the hotel and if you need a quick bite of the best NYC pizza walk over to Prince Street Pizza or Rubirosa.

title: Great atmosphere and location, but best for a one night stay.
text: The experience was great. Friendly service at check in. Great service at the bar. The place had a hip feel and lots of conversation in the common areas and bar. Solid internet connection.  My room was clean, decorated in a modern hip way, and serviceable. I’d give the place 5 stars but it is definitely for some types of trips vs. others which is why I gave a 4. There were some misses. The restaurant was not open. Found out it was closed on Monday (night I stayed). Getting to the hotel at 9p after travel was too late to walk around the Chinatown area in search of food. The front desk said there was no room service but the restaurant was open (no). Was given a menu at the bar but told when trying to order food the kitchen was closed on Mondays. You could see the staff trying to avoid the issue of no food - they knew it was an issue. Used Uber Eats. I was not the only one. The bar options are basic even as it was a hopping place. It would benefit from more interesting drink options and wider selection of spirits and wines to further draw people in. The room is small, which is okay and typical for NYC. But there is no closet (fixed hangers hang on a bar under the TV), no mini fridge, and no coffee maker. Water bottles are $5 in the room. If here on business, the desk is the size of a small side table. If I used the open up luggage stand I couldn’t navigate around the bed. This is a great place to put your head down for a night but spend the majority of the time out and about.

title: Birthday Trip
text: We Loved the Moxy on Bowery from the moment we arrived and were greeted by Victor who welcomed us and made us feel like he was truly happy we were there! Every employee that I encountered at the Moxy made the experience that much better with their cool,  easy going vibe that matches the feel of the hotel!

title: Best hotel, Amazing staff, So fun, Great location!
text: Victor and Leidy made our experience even more elevated than expected. Upon arrival they upgraded our room and offered free drink tickets. Everyone was super kind and the room was beautiful. We will definitely be back!

title: Loved the Moxy!
text: Welcoming enthusiast staff! Super kind people in all areas! Clean and cute rooms! Soft bedding comfy bed. Would definitely stay again! Fun piano bar next door to hang late. Fun and cute decor for cute photos!

title: Great Stay!
text: Upon arrival we were greeted by Asheley Leidg who assisted us with checking in. She was very nice and professional and even made sure that our room was ready as we had arrived early. 10/10 service and the hotel was great. Will recommend the Moxy to anyone staying in LES.

title: Perfect Location! Great Experience!
text:
An amazing experience! The Moxy is located in an ideal location for shopping, food and entertainment. 

The staff are AMAZING!! Demario was very attentive and made sure we had a great experience. 

We plan to return and share this hotel with our family and friends!!

title: 70. BIRTHDAY
text: Sehr schöner Aufenthalt in New York. Das Moxy in der Bowery hat uns rundum sehr gut versorgt. Die Hotelmanagerin LEIDY PEREZ kümmerte sich darum, dass wir ein sehr großes Zimmer bewohnen konnten, obschon uns dieses aufgrund eines Buchungsfehlers nicht Zustand. Beide Daumen hoch für Leidy und ein herzliches Dankeschön für das gesamte Team des Moxy NYC.

title: Super fun hôtel with an excellent location and vibes
text: We hesitated between cityzen hôtel next door to moxy LES but our stay here was beyond our expectations . First of all the welcome of the staff at the front desk in the lobby was fantastic and warm . Then the decor all through the hotel is superb and very much arty . The room ( 1205 and 1204 ) very cosy with a stunning view on the manathan bridge and the Brooklyn bridge . The bar in the lobby is awesome . The rooftop club is superb with a spectacular view ( 360 on the big apple ) . The 30 bucks daily credit was definetly a plus . Thank you thank you thank you

title: Perfetto sotto ogni punto di vista
text:
Siamo stati 6 notti al Moxy LES madre e 3 figli adolescenti. L’hotel è perfetto come posizione, 2 fermate metro vicinissime e la J che porta dritto in aeroporto.
Personale: Kim, Curtis e Steph sono stati gentilissimi, servizio super veloce in arrivo e partenza, deposito bagagli affidabile, tutti sorridenti e disponibili. La camera per 4 era tutto sommato più spaziosa del previsto, i letti hanno sotto dei cassettoni dove si possono riporre i vestiti ma soprattutto i trolley (più difficile se se viaggia con 4 valige grandi). Vista (10 piano) meravigliosa. Il bagno davvero molto grande aveva la tenda, se a prima vista l’ho ritenuta una pecca, nell’uso in 4 si è rivelata un bel vantaggio perché forniva privacy mentre un’altra persona si preparava sveltendo la preparazione e quindi l’uscita. Riscaldamento personalizzabile. Doppi cuscini, prese usb. Acqua in camera molto gradita. Qualche appendino in più in bagno sarebbe stato utile per lavare meno asciugamani. L’atmosfera dell’albergo è giovane e vivace, al bar al piano terra sono gentilissimi, non abbiamo mangiato al ristorante nè usato il rooftop che è chiuso dal lunedì al mercoledì. Sabato sera la musica è molto alta ma noi abbiamo dormito benissimo comunque. Le camere sono ottimamente insonorizzate perché non abbiamo mai sentito rumori dai vicini. L’ascensore si prende solo con la tessera. Caffè a disposizione al bar la mattina fino ad un certo orario, direi 9.30.
Nel complesso non avrei potuto sperare di meglio. Praticamente perfetto! 
Grazie ai ragazzi per il bel soggiorno.

title: Mum and Daughters trip to NYC
text: We have been to NYC several times before, this was our first time at The Moxy, and we have found a new favourite hotel!  The location was perfect for the subway, Little Italy, Chinatown, Lower Manhattan.  The hotel is beautifully laid out, the rooms were clean and fun.  The security of having to use keys to access the elevator and rooms was reassuring.  The staff were welcoming and beyond kind and patient.  We dealt with Leidy, Ashley and the coffee shops staff, all of whom were so lovely!!  We can’t wait to stay here again.

title: Best hotel stay in NYC!
text: Hands down one of the best hotel experiences ever! Jess was extremely accommodating and funny while checking me in. The view of the Empire State Building was breathtaking. You feel like royalty when you step in the building. No doubt I will be back!

title: SO. DAMN. SEXY!
text:
Moxy is *the best* hotel brand in NYC - and this new venue proves it.
Once again, Lightstone Group has created a modern, flirtatious space that over-delivers without the expense. The rooms are super-handsome and all have king-sized beds, providing quality comfort for every guest, plus: clever storage design, power showers and designer sinks. 
There's an Asian restaurant in the basement, a rooftop nightclub and an Instagram-friendly lobby bar. Best of all, there's a piano bar which is STUNNING and makes Moxy LES a no-brainer for smart travellers. Go, go, go!

title: Very good stay
text: Beautiful hotel, but night club can be loud and disrupts sleep at night. Yirma has been awesome upgrading my room and even provided a complimentary champagne drink. Room is very clean and gym is perfect.

title: Moxy Hotel Stay
text: This was my first time staying at the moxy hotel and Yirma went above and beyond in making my stay so amazing. She was able to help me with a minor issue i had and fixed it. Yirma definitely made my stay more enjoyable

title: NY Girls Trip!!
text: One of the best hotel experiences I’ve had in New York! From the cleanliness to the hospality, it is everything you can ask for and more! The moment you walk in, you are greeted! The ambiance, the young, fresh decor of the hotel was everything! The staff were amazing to say the least! From Yas, Leidy, Jess, Marilyn, and Edwin, they were all great! BUT the true stand out was Demario! Demario not only upgraded our stay for my friend’s birthday, but he also personalized the room by adding balloons, a card, and leaving a cute message on the mirror when we got back from our girls day out! You would’ve thought we were friends and family the way they treated us! Definitely a trip for the books! When I say this is the hotel to beat, I mean it!

title: Amazing staff, had a good time
text: Great ambience and staff, we had a little water problem and for the inconvenience they gave us a complimentary night which was very thoughtful of them. Thank you to Nelly and Leidy they took care of all our need. Much appreciated. Be back soon.

title: Service is Wonderful
text:
We had a wonderful stay at the Moxy! The location was great and made for a very authentic experience with a ton of local food options. The front desk staff wonderful, and the restaurant and bar offerings on site were pleasant. They even welcome you to the hotel with a glass of champagne. It made kicking off the stay feel that much better!

We initially faced a small hiccup while checking in, but Jess at the front desk was fantastic in addressing our concerns and even followed up with us after check out. You can tell the staff here really cares about the level of service they provide and they are invested in you leaving satisfied.  I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good hotel and a good time in the city.

title: This hotel is it….
text:
I decided to treat myself to a staycation and  have had my eye on this hotel so decided to give it a shot. From the moment I arrived until my check out I had such an amazing time.
The hotel is beautiful, ladies at the front desk were friendly and attentive, my room was spacious with an extremely comfortable bed (I felt as though I was sleeping on clouds), Restaurant was delicious and offered me a great spot to have a cocktail and people watch. 
Literally everything was perfect…I have to say I was sad to have to check out but this just means I  HAVE to come back.

title: Loved my stay
text: Mannnn. I walked in frustrated and immediately Demario Booker could feel my stress, so he took it upon himself to care for me. Got me checked in quickly with the upmost respect and made sure the rest of my stay went without any hiccups. Definitely found my new place to stay in NYC.

title: Moxy Hotel
text: i recently went here with my family and I stayed for a couple nights and had a magnificent time , really great hotel and the bar was great. everyone had a smile on their face. This staff was wonderful. Rooms were very clean a little small but that’s New York standards but rooms were magnificent breakfast in restaurant was amazing. I also like how easy check in at front desk was i will definitely be going back .

title: Good stylish hotel
text: My family booked 2 rooms at this hotel and it was a great experience! Rooms are small, even for New York City style but it did made us go outside and enjoy. So would recommend if that’s the case. Stephanie and Curtis were excellent. Very attentive and even helped us managing our luggage to the room. The coffee in the mornings it’s also good!

title: Very clean & updated rooms great staff service
text: I would have to say my overall experience at the Moxy was wonderful from checking in  being seamless to all the great amenities in my room. The service at the bar was exceptional. The bartender I couldn’t remember their name, but the service was beyond exceptional. Me and my girlfriend had a lovely time. Will definitely be visiting the moxy again and will definitely tell , our friends and family. Jess & Yasira from front desk was great !

title: A straight up gross hotel.
text:
I can accept that the rooms are tiny (even by nyc standards) , but what I cannot abide is a dirty room that haven’t been cleaned properly.
