title: Excellent Customer Service
text: I stayed at Moxy hotel on the Lower East side while attending a business meeting. I ended up in a room that unfortunately had a very loud fan in the hallway. Apparently, there had been some flooding on that floor recently which is why they were running the fan. This is a temporary issue. Yirma at the front desk was extremely helpful. She went out of her way to find me a much better room with a city view. The room was quiet, and I really appreciated the extra effort she put in to making sure my stay was pleasant.

title: Awesome Hotel with great location
text: This hotel puts you in the NY mood! Great lounge, rooftop and overall vibes of this hotel keep me coming back. Great staff and feel very safe on all accounts. Hotel rooms in NY can be very small but they do it right. For everything you need in the most convenient way.

title: Definitely coming back to Moxy LES
text: Everything was great! Great location! The staff was very welcoming, especially Kimberly, who was very helpful with checking-in. The room has precisely everything you need. Coming back to Moxy next time I come to New York!

title: Best staff ever!!!
text: I booked this hotel for my boyfriend’s birthday and the staff went above and beyond to make it special. Ashley and Kim decorated my room for his birthday and even put out the snacks I bought neatly on the table and they even offered to upgrade me. This was the best customer service I’ve ever experienced. They were so sweet and were genuinely happy that they could help me make my boyfriend’s birthday special. They made my experience here amazing and we’ll definitely be coming back soon.

title: Moxy is a really good place to stay in NYC
text: I stayed with my family and had a great time! Everyone was so nice and helpful. Ashley was super friendly and attentive to all of our needs, she helped us navigate the city and suggested great places to eat.  I will truly recommend anyone to come stay here.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Moxy has a great spot in lower east side. Hotel is awesome from the bar to the room and everything in between. 
Rooms are small but work great. Plenty of room and everything is super clean. And Yirma at the front desk took great care of us.

title: "Amazing Experience!!!"
text: My Experience at Moxy LES was truly amazing! I was greeted at the front desk by Ashley who was very sweet and extremely helpful while checking me and my friends  into our rooms. The rooms were so nice and I had a beautiful view of the city. The beds were super comfortable and clean I felt right at home. Ashley definitely made my stay at the Moxy LES very memorable. I will definitely  be visiting again soon!

title: So far, fantastic!
text: So far, so fantastic! When I pulled up to the hotel it was freezing out and the doorman was there to welcome me and usher me in out of the cold. The lobby was beautiful, people surrounding the bar, the ambiance was perfect. Victor checked me in, he made sure to honor all my requests, helped me by giving me details about the property and tokens for Prosecco. I’m very happy here, room is not large, but that’s normal for NYC. Neighborhood is great, lots of amazing restaurants nearby.

title: The best hotel experience in the USA
text:
I stayed at the Marriott moxy LES for 2 weeks in Manhattan. As someone that is traveling every other month, I have to say this is the best experience I have had in the last 2 years in a hotel.   As someone that runs their own business, i understand how important customer service can be and the staff of the moxy was far superior to any hotel I have been at.

I was immediately greeted by Leidy, the sweetest and kindest person that made me feel so at home even though I was on the other side of the country! 

Overall The hotel was spectacular, from the silver lining lounge piano room, the lobby lounge, the rooftop bar, the gym. Even the elevator system was so fast and helpful! I loved the amenities being listed with the hours they were open it was super helpful.

I spent a good amount of time in the lobby lounge, the coffee was always out on time, the pastries were delicious, and it was amazing to have access to both the front room where it was quieter and the main area where I could interact with other hotel guests.

I made 2 friends in the lobby due to the setup and we are still in touch!

Housekeeping was super nice and every time I walked by the front desk I was greeted with a smile walking in or out of the hotel. I ordered door dash a few times and they would hold it there for me.

I was truly treated like a part of a family, not just a guest, they catered to me and I felt really special there.

Thank you so much  Leidy for making me feel so at home while being far from my home,  I am excited to book again so when I come back this year, there is no other hotel I would choose!

title: We had a ball!
text: We give the Moxy LES Five stars! The hotel is beautiful and the team here is tip-top. They were beyond accommodating and made our stay fun and comfortable! Everyone was lovely. We will be back again soon to visit.

title: Issy and Nevelyn provide VIP customer service at the Cafe d’Avignon. The Cafe is beautiful and I highly recommend it.
text: Issy and Nevelyn provide VIP customer service at the Cafe d’Avignon. I highly recommend it. It’s open from 7 am to 3 pm and then converts into a bar. The coffee , pastries, sandwiches are amazing and prepared with much care. I was very impressed.

title: Amazing experience, will be back.
text:
Leidy and her team were fantastic. The quality of care and cleanliness were unmatched, the bar was great and so were the highline. We will absolutely be back to stay. Our trip was a mix of business and fun, so comfortability was key, The Moxy was perfect for both. 

Thanks Leidy and team!

title: Best Hip Hotel at Lower East Side w/ Best Views and Best Location!
text: The new Moxy Lower East Side exceeded our expectations!  Their lobby is so welcoming w/ great decor/features & the rooms have the best views!  Big shout out to Nelly, Leidy, Stephanie, Nicki & the other Moxy team members whole were so welcoming and awesome to our family!

title: THE MOST INCREDIBLE HOTEL
text: I have never left a review for a hotel but this hotel was one of the best I’ve ever stayed in. First off, we arrived pretty early on our check in day around 11 am which we prepared to not be allowed in early since check in time was 4pm. They were going to call us as soon as the rooms were ready, and as we waited in the lobby/cafe area, Nelly came back and told us the rooms were ready for us at 11:30!!!! This has literally never happened to me, usually if we arrive to early we have to wait til it’s closer to check in or we may have to pay a fee. Next, I can’t even begin to explain how beautiful this hotel is! It’s so aesthetically pleasing and modern, definitely a more luxury experience but for half the price! They give you a little token for a free glass of Prosecco at their bar. We booked the Executive King Room with a City view, and I HIGHLY recommend this room. The view is literally incredible, with floor to ceiling windows and amazing views of New York City. Our friends got the King Bed with a city view which was still a nice view but the room as quite a bit smaller then ours. We ran into Nelly again in the elevator and asked if an upgrade was possible but she said unfortunately our style room was booked. They ended up receiving a $30 credit at the cafe and we thought that was to make up for it so that was great! All in all I would, 10/10 recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NY. Service and stay was EXCEPTIONAL!! Thank you Moxy Lower East Side!!

title: Hotel with ALL. THE. THINGS. I ❤️ Moxy Lower East Side
text:
I might have found my new favorite hotel in NYC. This place is stunning and has everything. Top tier sushi restaurant? Check. Rooftop indoor bar that is gorgeously designed and appointed? Beautifully designed lobby, bar, and rooms? Check. Nelly greeted me yesterday and immediately upgraded my room based on my status. Had a night cap with my coworker at the lounge. and then opted for a solo drink at the bar. Glori made me delicious cocktails and engaged in lovely conversation, listening intently and sharing her experiences living in NYC. I could’ve chatted with her all night—just a genuine and genuinely kind human being who treated every customer like gold.

title: A unique space that makes you feel special
text:
We were unsure about the room with two pairs of bunk beds, but it was AWESOME! The room was among the cleanest I've ever seen. Tidy and efficient.

And that's just the room. The bar, the restaurants, the spaces they've created are spectacular. The staff everywhere is knowledgeable, conversational, and ready to help with anything you need. For example, we asked where's the best local pizza at the bar, and the bartender called his manager to get the name of the place he always recommends! Who does that??

In short, highly recommended. The place is super cool, close to a lot of cool spots. Anything you want to do, just ask and they'll point you in the right direction.

title: Excellent Property
text: Excellent place to go. This is my third Moxy in NYC and it didn’t disappointed. Stephanie and Yirma took care of everything for me an my wife. Excellent service! The rooftop bar was really nice as well.

title: NYC Trip
text: We had a great experience at the Moxy, the decor is amazing and the hotel manager Leidy was super friendly and accommodating.  The location is central to shopping and awesome dining options.  The room is very cozy, we would definitely stay at the moxy again!

title: Fabulous trip
text: The Moxy Lower East is a gem. We arrived and the staff was incredible- Jes, Yaz and Vic greeted us and were wonderful during our entire stay. Friendly, informative, and going above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Issy, Nevelyn and Esther at the cafe lounge were amazing and attentive. title: Price, location, style, service + amenities = 5 star rating
text: I thoroughly enjoyed staying here, particularly in light of its Bowery location on the Lower East Side. I was last on the Bowery in 1982 and I am blown away by the extent of the changes sine that time.  Such a dynamic, edgy, and fascinating community has evolved and blossomed.  Don’t miss the nearby Essex Market. This neighborhood adjoins Little Italy, Soho, Chinatown and the East Village. An abundance of richness when it comes to cultures, cuisines, and sights! (and to be completely honest and transparent, on our last day we encountered human waste on the sidewalk across from the hotel, which unfortunately is a reality of the homeless situation that exists in the city and likely is more of a challenge on the Lower East Side.) But that said, the Moxy Lower East Side offers a very comfortable and secure way to access this dynamic neighborhood, now one of my favorite places to be in Manhattan. Service was attentive and quick/responsive. The rooms are on the small side (not unusual for NYC), but the design is very efficient and they offer fabulous floor to ceiling views of the Manhattan skyline.  The room was super clean, nice bedding and linens, and I really liked the separate walk-in shower with rain-type shower head.  We reserved the executive king room and I felt it provided the minimum amount of space that made us comfortable. The combination of location, modern amenities and design, and price is unbeatable. I’m sure I’ll be back!

text: My sisters and I took a girls trip for New Years and this hotel was perfect! Super cute rooms and view. Jess was very helpful and professional and everyone was so kind! Will definitely be coming back!

From the amazing views, to the cozy and comfy rooms, to the ABOVE AND BEYOND customer service (Shoutout to Leidy!!), this hotel has it all. title: The review to end all reviews!!!
text:
I can’t recommend this hotel enough!! Our trip started with an amazing smile and greeting by Bruce at the door. Everyone we came in contact with  was incredibly nice. Because we passed the front desk over the course of our stay many times, we could tell the sweet nice impression we got was consistent with other guests as well. 
We ran into a small issue due to heating in our room, which can happen, but the staff immediately fixed the issue without any prompting. Let’s just say we were out and about when we got the courtesy call from Demary at the front desk with a resolution. Remember I mentioned Bruce? He was at the door almost every morning and often into the afternoon. Each time a smile and warm welcome back. 
The rooms are cozy, but elegant. Beds were comfortable as well. Also great spots to eat right at the hotel. We went to Sake No Hana restaurant and enjoyed the food and time. Great spot downstairs in the hotel….and yes Bruce was there to catch the door with a smile and welcome. I would 100% book a stay here again, and recommend it to anyone. I promise you will not regret it. How do I rate the hotel and experience… ? exceptional!!! Everyone went above and beyond!

title: Worth it!

title: Does this place know it’s a hotel?
text: Oh boy. Where to start. I was very excited to stay at this hotel as I used to live across the street and love the area. I was extremely underwhelmed and disappointed. The facilities are nice enough upon first glance, but in my room the outlet cover randomly fell off, and the shower ran out of hot water after about 3 minutes. But, the title of my review is the main issue. Does this place know it’s a hotel? Sure, hospitality is a valuable part of a hotel, but I think most would agree that they goto hotels for a place to rest and stay. The Moxy LES advertises their multiple hospitality venues, but they aren’t accessible to guests. The first night I was there the rooftop bar was closed. The third night too. The second night, the main entrance to the hotel was closed for a private event, and hotel guests were directed to a small side door and through another bar. It was truly bizarre. Not only do you not get to use the advertised spaces, but you’re made to feel like an inconvenience for simply trying to return to your room. Also, funny enough, the social team posted about the “catwalk entrance” of the hotel at the exact time the entrance was closed to guests. Also, the elevator system is complicated as the elevator names and signage don’t match up with what the screen says. And one elevator is through a service door and very unclear it’s available for use. That is if it is. I scanned my card and was directed to that elevator, only to be told by a worker that hotel is only for the rooftop bar after 5pm. Not sure what to tell you, dude, that’s where the system told me to go. Very disappointing service and priorities. I hope they get it together.

title: No leas más reseñas, Hospédate aquí!!
text:
Después de leer muchas reseñas sobre la mejor estancia para nuestra primer visita en New York, encontramos esta joya en el desierto. Había muchos puntos negativos en diferentes hoteles (viejos, mala atención, descuidados, sin servicio de limpieza) y en Moxy Lower East Side encontramos todo lo contrario.

La mejor ubicación a solo 2 minutos caminando a la línea naranja del subway, la mejor atención desde el minuto uno entrando la puerta, Daniel siempre con una sonrisa y una frase amable todo el tiempo, de verdad un gran chico.

En recepción Yasira hizo de nuestra estancia una estancia perfecta, siempre sonriente, amable, genuinamente dispuesta a ayudar. Un día nos recomendó su pizza preferida y de verdad que fue la mejor pizza en New York que probamos. Gracias!!

En el bar bebidas deliciosas, ambiente súper agradable, muy buen servicio y atención, nos recibieron con espumosos para inaugurar nuestras vacaciones y no dejen de probar el Espresso Martini uff!!

La habitación no era muy grande pero con el tamaño exacto para nosotros 4 y efectivamente, aunque no tenía clóset, había almacenamiento suficiente distribuido de manera práctica en toda la habitación para acomodar nuestras cosas. Las camas deliciosas para descansar como bebés después de un día de turismo cansadísimo.

Marily y Victor nos apoyaron con el check out para que fuera super sencillo, rápido y amable. Gracias Moxy!! Volveremos con ustedes y los recomendaremos siempre!

title: My new go-to on the LES
text:
This hotel is the newest gem on the hip, edgy lower east side.  Only opened a month ago in November, 2022, this hotel is sleek, modern, and full of stylish art, decor, and furniture.

This hotel, which runs in the 300-400 dollar range depending on size and view, has four drinking/dining/entertainment options in house.  The Fix (lobby, bar, all day cafe).  Silver Lining, a piano bar.  Sake No Hana, Japanese dishes.  The Highlight Room, their indoor/outdoor rooftop bar.  And Loosie’s, a subterranean dance floor decorated with disco balls.

When you check in, you get a free drink token for The Fix!

The lobby is sparkling and gorgeous.  The checkin staff is awesome.

I stayed in the executive city view suite, which is a corner suite with views of the Empire State Building, Chinatown, Little Italy, and other parts of Manhattan.  There are less expensive rooms with less impressive views or no views at all.

Rooms are well laid out.  Separate toilet and nice shower.  And you’ll see some people complaining about room size, but honestly, most of the rooms on the Lower East Side are small, efficiently laid out spaces.  One or two people would be perfectly comfortable.

Fun touches like an erotic vending machine and a candy stand.  They have complimentary bikes, a fitness center, a co-working/business space.  TVs have streaming.  Comfy, soft, fresh and crisp beds.

Again, on the LES, close to SoHo, close to street art and murals.  Lots of restaurants.  Little Italy.  Chinatown.  Very walkable.  Easy to go right over the bridge to Brooklyn as well.

I have stayed many times at CitizenM on the Bowery and Moxy in the East Village.  I’ve stayed at several Moxy hotels in various cities.  This is the hippest and the best.  It’s going to be my new go-to.

title: Great stay
text: Had a great stay at the Moxy lower east side. The decor is to die for and I had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building from my room. The rooms are a bit peculiar as the sink for the bathroom is right in your bedroom but it was fun and didn’t bother me, just different from other hotels. Staff was super friendly. You’re charged a $30 fee everyday but you can use it at their cafe or bar. The pastries and coffee are pretty yummy. I asked the bartender at the bar for a fun mocktail and he created an amazing drink for me. I was also very impressed with the elevator system, they have 4 elevators so getting up and down was pretty fast, hard to find with nyc hotels. Checked out of the hotel with Marilyn at the front desk who was delightful. Would recommend a stay here. The only downsides are the rooms are smaller than typical hotel rooms but I stayed alone so that was fine

title: Visited twice within 30 days and returning for a 3rd time
text:
I've been here twice.
The first time was for nearly a week right when they opened.
The second time was for 2 nights.
I'm already scheduled for another stay within 45 days since they opened. I'm not too big of a fan of Marriott properties, but I am an absolute fan of Moxy LES - but it's really especially down to the Moxy/Marriott team, both the overnights and day times. Apart from the growing pains since the opening (dust, ongoing construction, weird power outages here and there) and the rooms being slightly tight for 2 people, I honestly enjoy myself.
I think the main selling point for me is always coming back to the Moxy front desk team themselves. 
I'm talking Victor, to Marilyn, to Deshawn, to Jess, to nearly everyone I've come across with and chatted with - they've always made sure my issues were met, and I felt like a priority (even when it's busy or TAO personnel tries to throw their weight around). I met each one of them and they're all amazing, but I only had the card for 4 of them - but it doesn't mean that the love and appreciation isn't there for the people I haven't named. Seeing them and having them remember me makes it feel like a real family thing - which is what any customer wants to feel when they're away from home for work or anything.

You can't teach humility and human connectivity with strangers. The team itself is probably what will make this Moxy a damn jewel in the city. Listen, any team that makes me feel happy that I'm sending them cheesecakes or pies or food so they can feel a little comfortable and happy working, is a team I look forward to.

I'm going back literally in 24 hours and I already know, that they know, that we're going to have a solid weekend during the holidays.

Great proximity to restaurants and bars (Corner Bar, Thai Diner, Skin Contact). But so much can be said about the venues within Moxy itself! The rooftop bar (Highlight Room) has incredible views of the city and the decor is stunning. Loosie's nightclub downstairs is a hot spot to get lost on the dancefloor to 70s-80s disco.

I had an amazing time and the employees were always warm and welcoming. Thank you, Curtis, Jess, Leidy, Yasira, Stephanie and the entire Moxy team for a great stay.

title: Interesting, Not Family Friendly Hotel
text:
My wife and I took our kids (10/7) to NYC for one night in December and stayed here.  I have a mixed overall review and would not stay here again.  

Pros:
Cool vibe-sushi bar in the lobby, great decor.  

Really nice front desk people

Location-couple of blocks walking to Soho and close enough to different subway lines.  Three blocks from Little Italy and Broome St right nearby have what seem like great restaurants.

Cons:
I wouldn't consider this a family friendly hotel.  Probably my fault for not looking it up as I booked last minute.  There were a group of 20 something girls partying and screaming in their rooms/hallway while my kids were trying to sleep.  My guess is they were going to the nightclub downstairs.

The rooms are really small.  But most are in NY.   Think of it as the size of a really small bedroom.  But they are interesting, have nice bathrooms (also tiny) and high ceilings.

Location-the neighborhoods directly west and north are great.  Not so much east and south.  

If traveling without kids, I'd give it a slightly higher ranking.  But I would definitely stay somewhere when traveling with younger kids.

text:
I often hear that hotel choice is not important when visiting NYC as you are expected to spend days and nights exploring the city. But boy, did this new Moxy Lower East Side changed this perception. I could not have been more excited to spend hours in this hotel - exploring the amazing bars, restaurants, and common areas while soaking in the amazing interior design.

 The hotel is super chic and upbeat, but at the same time it's cozy, warm and so family friendly. I explored the city, but then I just wanted to come back and unwind in the hotel.

The rooms are exceptional, fresh and clean. It reminded of Japanese cleanliness and efficiency. You have separate large walk in shower with ornate glass, the red industrial sink just pops. My queen bed was extremely comfortable and the room is well lit. There a small desk that folds onto the wall to create extra space - so very thoughtful. My queen room had plenty of storage for two people. 

The team that works at the Moxy is amazing. As I walked in, I was showered with "welcome, welcome!!" and smiles everywhere. It truly made my feel special. 

Finally, the drinks and food was amazing. It's all done in  collaboration with TAO group - which I learned operates some of the best restaurants in USA. 

For the price per night, you get much more than you pay for! A top quality experience. You will not regret. The pictures don't lie :)))

title: Beautiful Space
text: It’s my first time at a mirco hotel and I wasn’t too sure what to expect. Moxy exceeded my expectations! I was impressed with the beautiful details of the hotel. The layout was perfect for two people without being too crammed. The shower and bathroom were in separate rooms,  which were both very clean. The front desk and downstairs staff were all very helpful and welcoming. I highly recommend the breakfast- there were croissants, scones, yogurt, and hot food (eggs, potatoes, bacon). The croissants weren’t your sad typical hotel croissants, but it was something I would have purchased at a local coffee shop. We look forward to staying at Moxy Lower East Side again in the future!

title: Cannot recommend this hotel enough!!!
text: Every year for my birthday, my girlfriends and I come to NYC to celebrate, shop, eat, etc… i booked this hotel because of the fun bunk bed rooms they have available which is perfect when traveling with 4 people… little did I know how beautiful, clean and thoughtfully designed this hotel is. You could truly not leave the hotel all day and have plenty to do. Coffee in the cafe, the highlight room, sake bar, and you can’t forget Loosies in the basement which is a fun disco club (we ended our evenings dancing here every night) my absolute favorite part of the hotel was the way the people who worked here made me feel… from the start, they were SO happy, positive, and kind. Jess and Yasira made me and my friends feel welcomed from the start and went above and beyond throughout our entire stay. They even surprised by decorating our room with balloons, banners, wrote a fun birthday note on the mirror… I was SO surprised. Their good energy is infectious and I can’t thank the moxy team enough for such a lovely stay!!! Will definitely be coming back in the future

title: Fun new hotel in great location
text: Loved our stay here. Got to stay one of the first nights open. Rooms are small but very well planned. Maximized all space. Shower head and mattress were great. Loved all the common areas we got to experience. All were not open just yet. Full, delicious breakfast and a well stocked bar in the lobby. We will definitely be back.

title: Solid NYC hotel
text:
Trendy hotel vibe.  Great location a few minutes walk from the Soho shopping area, Chinatown, and Little Italy restaurants. Subway station one block away.
Room felt a bit small, but the space was efficiently used and all the essentials were there (safe, full-body mirror, cable TV with 100 channels, plenty of power outlets and lights).  Room was clean, and the bed was VERY comfortable.  Overall I think it's a great choice for solo travelers and couples.

title: Love the new Moxy!
text: Beautiful new hotel in the best NYC neighborhood! Lots of public space to enjoy, and I can't wait to come back and check out all the new bars and restaurants. The guest rooms are small but smart, still room for everything I needed.

title: Great Hotel with AMAZING service!!!
text:
I had the best time staying there for the NY marathon this weekend, room had everything I needed, the cafe and the attendants were the perfect morning fix and the best of it all was the incredible service from the Front desk crew! Every single one of them was amazing every encounter! (And did not mind me leaving the key in the room a million times!) 
Overall great great great experience! Thank you!!!

title: Birthday weekend
text: Celebrated my birthday and stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is super friendly. I plan on staying here the next time i come to NY😊 The room is comfortable and the rooftop bar has a gorgeous view of the city!

title: Top Notch Service and Sleep!
text: We loved this incredible new hotel! The location is perfect, we stumbled upon a ton of great restaurants and bars. The beds were super comfortable and the blackout curtains works so well, I barely woke up! The gym is big and has everything you need (which is hard to find city hotels these days). The front desk staff was incredibly welcoming and friendly. You could tell they are excited to be there! The overall hotel design is exceptional and made me feel like I picked the right spot in a trendy location. The view from the rooftop alone is reason enough to stay. The hotel made for a perfect weekend in NYC. We will absolutely be back!

title: Amazing and attentive staff
text:
Nice and cozy hotel that fits your needs and budget while exceeding your expectations.
Loved every encounter at the hotel in the four restaurants and the reception as well as the housekeeping staff.
It has a retro look to it yet utilizing an smart modern design that maximize the sense of space and utility of the amenities in the room. The bathroom is separate from the shower with colorful sliding glass doors.

title: Solid stay at a new hotel!
text: Was excited to try this hotel out about a week after it opened, and it didn't disappoint! The complimentary prosecco on check-in was a great perk. We were very happy with the room and the view, and it was surprisingly quiet. The complimentary breakfast spread was solid, and the staff were friendly and ready to help. I'll be excited to try it again once all of the new restaurants in the building are fully open!

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a great location. The staff was so amazing and accommodating. Incredible views!  Will be back!  The complementary breakfast and Prosecco tokens were very appreciated and delicious!  Close to great Italian and Chinese food!

title: Amazing hotel
text: What a great hotel that is perfectly placed to enjoy the neighbourhoods of NYC. It also had all the amenities you want in a hotel. Rooms are even overs sized for the price of a boutique hotel. The lobby bar is a great place to have a drink with some liveliness to have a conversation with a guest and the space if you don’t. With the downstairs lounge, Loosies and rooftop bar, Highlight room, you wouldn’t need to leave the hotel to accommodate your nightlife needs. Staff were  always welcoming you and were helpful whenever asked for anything. Especially the manager Leidy. Can’t wait to come back.

title: I have never had a worse experience at a Marriott property than I had here.
text:
I have never had a worse experience at a Marriott property than I had here.

My room did not have a working shower. I only found this out the morning after arrival when I went to take one… and not a drip of water came out. I called in, they said they’d have an engineer come fix it… while I needed to head off to important buisness meetings unshowered.

I get back that evening, assuming it was fixed… and it still wasn’t working with no communication to me that it wasn’t successfully fixed. They let me use a neighboring room to shower as I didn’t have time before work to pack everything up and move it to a new room. They told me again they could send an engineer us and I said I was unsure how that’d be helpful as they didn’t fix it yesterday.

Finally on the third day I took them up on the offer to change rooms and it too *45* minutes for them to send up a room key to a different room wasting my weekend in New York.

Truly the worst hospitality experience I’ve had in New York.

I can’t recommend staying here and would even recommend the moxy east village was a great stay last time.

title: Excellent as always!
text: I have been to several of the Moxy locations and have always been so happy. The new location, not surprisingly, was amazing! The lobby is gorgeous, not one detail overlooked. The staff was kind and attentive across the board. The room was clean, well appointed and comfortable (and I am VERY picky about beds). The rooftop bar had just opened and made for one the best nights I have had in a long time. The views, drinks and DJ were all incredible. The location was also great, a very short walk to some amazing restaurants. I can't recommend this hotel enough and will definitely be back!

title: Comfortable Rooms & Amazing Location
text: My partner and I recently spent a weekend at Moxy LES. The staff was incredibly welcoming, and our check in experience was efficient. The room had a fantastic skyline view and was extremely clean with a cute design. The hotel is in a fantastic location - a short walk from amazing restaurants, shopping in Soho and the fun lively nightlife of the lower east side. I highly recommend Moxy LES if you're looking for a great location downtown.

title: Birthday Stay
text: I stayed here for two nights for my girlfriend’s birthday. The location of the hotel is perfect walking distance to everything you need. The hotel itself is beautiful with a great bar and lounge inside. The staff is very helpful and the manager, Lady Perez, is amazing. Could not have had a better stay!

title: Amazing!
text: Amazing!! Staff was so friendly and greeted us with smiles every time!  They even called us by our names and greeted us with drinks chips.  Best location - soho and right near Little Italy. Rooms are modern and beds are comfy. Great views of the city!  Nice rooftop bar.  So refreshing to come to a welcoming and modern/retro place with friendly employees.

title: 5/5 stars!
text: The new Moxy location is to die for! Not only is the staff wonderful, but the hotel is beautiful! I was greeted upon arrival with a token to take to the bar and claim my glass of Prosecco! The rooms were gorgeous and had amazing makeup lighting which is really important to me! I will be back to this location as soon as possible.

title: Finally a killer hotel in the area
text: I drop into New York often and enjoy staying in this general zone. There's a bounty of killer restaurants and I seem to scavenge out a great new bar each time I'm here. What I've most wanted in this area though (short of a resort) is a solid hotel where I'd also be excited to invite some of my local friends to party. I don't mean to knock the independents in the area, but really I think I've given each of them at least one shot, and I don't feel compelled to go back now that I've got this place on my radar. I should mention that this isn't just a new hotel, this is a new BUILDING... as clean and can be with all the modern perks. To be honest, the breakfast here alone would have sold me with the arsenal of fresh pastries at the bar. The room was way nicer than what I expected for the money, and had insane views looking north where I could see the peaks of the city's skyscrapers. I know Moxy's reputation speaks for itself, but just want to ping this one as it's new and should definitely be marked for anyone wanting to stay near soho/LES.

title: Everything was amazing!
text: First time staying at a Moxy property and definitely won’t be the last. Was in town for a girls trip and the rooms were so comfortable and had everything we needed. Lighting was great for getting ready. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. The bartenders made amazing cocktails. Doormen remembered us every time. Will definitely be back!

title: Honey Moon Extravaganza
text: The Moxy and staff are incredibly amazing. We were greeted by Maureen Boswell and her staff as if we were the only guest in the hotel. Now that’s customer service. Everyday we were there was if it was the first. The breakfast was delightful and fresh. The atmosphere was exquisite and quint at the same time. We weren’t guess we were family. The city life was just steps away from the front doors. Our room was cozy and the amenities were delightful. Thank you Moxey and staff for giving us a honeymoon that we will never forget.

title: "Wow! Just Wow!"
text:
I had such a good time! The hospitality is top-notch, the bar is amazing. Moxy hotels did it again!

I slept like a log, woke up and had an intense urge to write this review as though it was my first and most important call of duty for the day: to let it be known, that the Moxy in the lower east side is a level-up for the neighborhood!

title: Top notch everything
text: Immediately upon checking in I was greeted and helped by incredibly amenable staff who made me feel right at home. The service was the same for my entire stay. My room was perfect, great view, comfortable bed, nice amenities, etc. The location couldn't be better. I look forward to trying the multiple restaurants inside when they open soon! I will definitely be back.

title: Amazing stay at the new Moxy LES
text: I checked in to the new Moxy for a little staycation and really loved this new hotel. I had a super comfortable & clean room that had sweeping views of the city skyline. Every staff member I encountered, from the check- in to the cleaning staff were delightful and eager to help. When I went to check out the following day, I stopped by the cafe in the morning which served delicious croissants & coffee. I highly recommend this hotel for someone that wants to be close to the action in Downtown NYC!

title: The best location coupled with crazy good service
text: Nikki welcomed us with genuine appreciation for our visit. The proximity of this boutique hotel to amazing restaurants and bars was perfect for us. We also spent the morning on a beautiful walk over the Brooklyn Bridge. It was an intimate hotel with all the right amenities and accommodations.  The bar made a good bourbon cocktail and we loved the shuffleboard. We will definitely be back!

title: Moxy Lower East Side
text: I got here on the grand opening of the hotel and was very impressed with the hotel but also the staff. Nikki went over and above to make sure I was taken care of. Will definitely be back as this was a perfect start to my trip!
